Description: Limestone window-grille, painted red. Though parts are now missing, the original form is clear: two rows of three, narrow, vertical apertures.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:30/675 The North Suburb, Quarter in the Wadi, House T.34.3.
Curator's comments: Published: Frankfort & Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 2: 67 Window-grilles from Amarna vary significantly in shape and presence of decoration, and examples are known in limestone, wood and even reeds. For other examples, see Pharaohs of the Sun (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1999), no.163 Peet and Woolley, City of Akhenaten I (London, 1923): pl.6
